questions.question_text: While using the CMDB, what do you call the component that needs to be managed in order to deliver services?
What is the first step in the process to import spreadsheet data into ServiceNow?

discussion.content: This is different then question 216. I guess if they give the option “define data source,” then that takes priority over “load data”?

Selected Answer: D
Initially I opted for C, but next question #323 kind of answers this. First step is Create Import Set.

Selected Answer: C
First you have to define the data source

This question is a bit tricky. If you go to the module "Load Data", you have first the option to select an existing import set or to create a new one. After that you select the "Source of the import", which could be a fiel, in this case a spreadsheet or a data source.

comments.content: I have to correct myself here. It asks you to select an existing table or to create a new table in the Import set table section, after you clicked on the "Load Data" module.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The question already defines the data source that is a spreadsheet, the next step should be create import set

comments.content: Hi how sure are you about the answer i'm about to appear for my exam. pls reply

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Define Data Source

Selected Answer: C
Defining the data source is essential as it specifies where the data is coming from, which in this case would be the spreadsheet. This step sets the foundation for the data import process by identifying the source file or connection that will provide the data to be imported into ServiceNow.

Selected Answer: C
C. Define Data Source

Defining the data source involves specifying the source from which you will be importing data. This is typically the first step before creating an Import Set or performing other import-related tasks.

Selected Answer: D

Preview Import Sets:
Execute Transform:

questions.question_text: What are the steps for importing data using an import set?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is the Way

Selected Answer: A
I agree with A, Create Import Set, then Transform map, then Transform data and lastly clean up.

choices.B: Create a Transform Map, Load Data, Transform Data, Run Transform Map Script
choices.C: Identify source; Import transform map; Run transformer; Verify import
choices.D: Select source file; Run AutoMap; Transform data; Clean up target table
choices.A: Create Import Set; Create transform map; Transform data; Clean up import table
